Switch clarity ON OFF Privacy policy close Study Research Explore Connect School of Computing Science Our staffDr Jessica EnrightMr Ethan KellyZhen Tian Dr Jessica Enright Reader (Computing Science) email: Jessica.Enright@glasgow.ac.uk M121 Lilybank Gardens Import to contacts https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0266-3292 Biography I completed a PhD at the University of Alberta in 2011 with Prof. Lorna Stewart, and then moved to Scotland for a postdoc at the University of Glasgow, followed by posts at the University of Stirling, University of Edinburgh, and now at the University of Glasgow. Research interests I have interests in intersection graph classes, temporal and multi-layered graphs, and parameterised algorithmics. In more applied work, I have interests in modelling and optimisation for agricultural and infectious disease applications, including diseases of terrestrial and aquatic livestock. During the COVID-19 pandemic, I contributed to pandemic modelling in various ways, including: As part of the Scottish Covid Response Consortium At events organised by the Virtual Knowledge Exchange in Mathematical Sciences Research groupsFormal Analysis, Theory & Algorithms Publications List by: Type | Date Jump to: 2025 | 2024 | 2023 | 2022 | 2021 | 2020 | 2019 | 2018 | 2017 | 2016 | 2015 | 2014 | 2011 | 2008 | 2007Number of items: 54.2025 Agdur, Vilhelm, Enright, Jessica ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0266-3292, Larios-Jones, Laura ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3322-0176, Meeks, Kitty ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5299-3073, Skerman, Fiona and Yates, Ella (2025) Approximating temporal modularity on graphs of small underlying treewidth.
